department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Native American woman in traditional dress kneels on floor surrounded by artificial and natural props: buffalo skull at right, buck at left, cattails, flowers surrounding lake with reflection of snow-capped mountains and pine trees; wood frame
text: Through her work, Wendy Red Star explores issues of authenticity and representation. In this pseudo-diorama, using kitschy wallpaper, plastic animals and scenery, the artist sits wearing her traditional Apsaalooka (Crow) outfit, the same type of garments her ancestors wore. This photograph blurs the line from stereotype to reality, from Native American as scenery to fabricated Hollywood sets, from authenticity to Western fantasy.
title: Summer (The Four Season series)
